sentence.text: miR‑498 overexpression induced cell cycle arrest and apoptosis while it suppressed epithelial‑mesenchymal transition (cytokine production) in liver cancer cells.
Furthermore, negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II knockdown recapitulated the inhibitory effects of miR‑498 overexpression in liver cancer cells.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Thus, we demonstrated that miR‑498 suppresses the growth and metastasis of liver cancer cells, partly at least, by directly targeting negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II, suggesting that miR‑498 may serve as a potential biomarker for the diagnosis and therapy of liver cancer

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
